page.title: 13Forestry in Leighfield
page.content: In 1985 the management of Launde Park Wood (803038) was taken over by the Northants District of the Forestry Commission. The wood had been neglected and their intention is to improve the quality of the timber. The northern part was planted in the 1920's and now has too many trees with low quality stems. Thinning will be needed in order to improve the quality of the ash and to bring it on to decent timber. The southern part was planted in the 1960's with oak and conifer in the same area, the idea being that the conifers will mature first and be removed leaving the oak to grow on into good timber. The conifers in the southern part are approaching maturity and should be felled. Small quantities of ash poles are removed from the wood for fencing.
